intro: Anisophyllum dioecum, commonly known as the mountain holly, is a dioecious shrub native to the western United States. It belongs to the family Berberidaceae and is characterized by its evergreen foliage and small, clustered flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky, well-drained soils at high elevations. Its leaves are elliptical with a leathery texture and a distinctive white midrib. Anisophyllum dioecum produces berries that are an important food source for birds and other wildlife.
